intro: Eriocaulon gracile var. puberulentum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, preferring shallow water or moist soil. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine, soft hairs, contributing to its varietal name "puberulentum." This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
